verses.text: 亞干犯罪以色列人在那當毀滅的物上犯了不忠實的罪；因為猶大支派中，謝拉的曾孫、撒底的孫子、迦米的兒子亞干，取了當毀滅的物，耶和華就向以色列人發怒。

words.note: Lit. 'commit sin'
Combined with 不 to mean 'unfaithful'

verses.text: 以色列人戰敗那時，約書亞從耶利哥派人到伯特利東邊，靠近伯．亞文的艾城去，吩咐他們說：「你們上去窺探那地。」那些人就上去，窺探艾城。

words.note: 艾 (Ài) is the city's name, 城 (chéng) means city.
艾 (Ài) is the city's name, 城 (chéng) means city.

verses.text: 他們回來，對約書亞說：「不需要全體人民都上去；只要大約二三千人就可以上去攻打艾城了；不必勞動全體人民都上那裡去，因為那裡的人很少。」

words.note: 艾 (Ài) is the city's name, 城 (chéng) means city.
Here means to exert effort or trouble.

verses.text: 於是人民中約有三千人上那裡去，但他們竟在艾城的人面前逃跑了。

words.note: 艾 (Ài) is the city's name, 城 (chéng) means city.

verses.text: 艾城的人擊殺了他們約三十六人；從城門前追趕他們，一直追到示巴琳；在山坡上把他們擊潰；人民的心就極其驚怕。

words.note: 艾 (Ài) is the city's name, 城 (chéng) means city.

verses.text: 約書亞和眾長老的求問約書亞就撕裂自己的衣服，和以色列人的長老，在耶和華的約櫃前，一同俯伏在地，直到晚上，也把塵土撒在頭上。

words.note: Refers to respected leaders, often spiritual.
Act of grief or despair in ancient times.
Refers to respected leaders, often spiritual.
Transliteration of Hebrew tetragrammaton YHWH.
An act of humility or worship.
Act of mourning or humility.

verses.text: 約書亞說：「唉！主耶和華啊，你為甚麼領這人民過約旦河，為要把我們交在亞摩利人的手中，使我們滅亡呢？我們寧願住在約旦河那邊倒好。

words.note: An exclamation of sorrow or regret.
Title for God or a master.
Transliteration of Hebrew tetragrammaton YHWH.

words.definition: in order to, so as to

verses.text: 主啊！以色列人既然在仇敵面前轉身逃跑，我還有甚麼可說的呢？

words.note: Title for God or a master.

verses.text: 迦南人和這地所有的居民聽見了，就必圍困我們，把我們的名字從這世上剪除，那時你為你的大名要怎樣行呢？」

words.note: Implies complete destruction, erasure.
Often refers to God's glory and honor.

verses.text: 耶和華的回答耶和華對約書亞說：「你起來，為甚麼這樣臉伏在地呢？

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew tetragrammaton YHWH.
Transliteration of Hebrew tetragrammaton YHWH.

verses.text: 以色列人犯了罪，違背了我吩咐他們的約定，因為他們取了那當毀滅的物，他們偷竊，並且說謊，又把那當毀滅的物放在自己的物件中。

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.
In biblical context, often refers to God's covenant.
Lit. 'thing that ought to be destroyed'. Refers to things devoted to destruction.
Introduces object of a verb, indicating its disposal.
Lit. 'thing that ought to be destroyed'. Refers to things devoted to destruction.
Used as a locative suffix.

verses.text: 所以，以色列人在他們的仇敵面前站立不住，在他們的仇敵面前轉身逃跑，因為他們成了當毀滅的。如果你們不把那當毀滅的物從你們中間除掉，我就必不再與你們同在了。

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.
Refers to being 'under the ban' or 'devoted to destruction'.
Introduces object of a verb, indicating its disposal.
Lit. 'thing that ought to be destroyed'. Refers to things devoted to destruction.
Common phrase for divine presence.
Indicates a new situation or completion.

verses.text: 你起來，要人民自潔，對他們說：『你們要自潔，預備明天；因為耶和華以色列的 神這樣說：以色列啊！你們中間有那當毀滅的物；除非你們把那當毀滅的物從你們中間除去，你們在仇敵的面前就不能站立得住。

words.note: To purify or consecrate oneself.
To purify or consecrate oneself.
The Hebrew name for God.
Can refer to the land, people, or spiritual entity.
Used here as a direct address to the people.
Lit. 'thing that ought to be destroyed'. Refers to things devoted to destruction.
Introduces object of a verb, indicating its disposal.
Lit. 'thing that ought to be destroyed'. Refers to things devoted to destruction.
Resultative complement indicating stability.

verses.text: 到了早晨，你們要按著支派前來，耶和華抽籤抽中的支派，要按著宗族前來；耶和華抽籤抽中的宗族，要按著家庭前來；耶和華抽籤抽中的家庭，男丁要一個一個前來。

words.note: Refers to the tribes of Israel.
The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to the tribes of Israel.
A division within a tribe.
The Hebrew name for God.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 如果那藏有當毀滅的物的人被抽籤抽中了，他和他所有的一切都要用火焚燒；因為他違背了耶和華的約，又因為他在以色列中作了愚昧的事。』」

words.note: Lit. 'thing that ought to be destroyed'. Refers to things devoted to destruction.
Indicates the agent of a passive action.
The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to the nation/people of Israel.
Used as a locative suffix.
Often implies moral or spiritual foolishness in the Bible.

verses.text: 抽籤抽中亞干約書亞清早起來，要以色列人按著支派前來；結果，猶大支派被抽籤抽中了；
他要猶大宗族前來，結果，謝拉的家族被抽籤抽中了；他要謝拉家族的男丁一個一個前來，結果，撒底被抽籤抽中了；

words.note: Refers to adult male members of a family/household.

verses.text: 他要撒底家中的男丁一個一個前來，結果，亞干被抽籤抽中了，亞干是迦米的兒子、撒底的孫子、謝拉的曾孫，是屬於猶大支派的。

words.note: Refers to adult male members of a family/household.

verses.text: 約書亞對亞干說：「我兒，我勸你把榮耀歸給耶和華以色列的 神，向他認罪，告訴我你作了甚麼事，不可向我隱瞞。」

words.note: A respectful or affectionate term of address.
Grammar particle placing object before verb.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 亞干認罪與受罰亞干回答約書亞，說：「我實在得罪了耶和華以色列的 神；我作過的事是這樣的。

words.note: The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Indicates a past action has been experienced.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'the things I did'.
Forms an adjectival phrase.

verses.text: 我在戰利品中，看見了一件美麗的示拿衣服、二千二百八十克銀子，和一條重五百七十克的金條；我因貪愛這些物件，就把它們拿去了；現在埋藏在我帳棚的地裡，銀子在底下。」

words.note: Indicates 'within' when used after a noun with '在'.

words.pinyin: èr qiān èr bǎi bā shí

words.note: Common in biblical context for dwelling, uncommon in modern daily use.

verses.text: 約書亞就派人跑到亞干的帳棚裡，果然見到東西埋藏在那裡，銀子在底下。

words.note: Suffix indicating 'inside' when used after a location.
Literally 'east-west', a compound meaning 'thing'.

verses.text: 他們就把東西從帳棚中拿出來，帶到約書亞和以色列人那裡，擺在耶和華面前。

words.note: Indicates 'from within' when used after a noun with '從'.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 約書亞和全體以色列人一起把謝拉的曾孫亞干和那銀子、那件衣服、那金條，以及亞干的兒女、牛、驢、羊、帳棚和他所有的一切，都帶上亞割谷去。
約書亞說：「你為甚麼給我們招惹災禍呢？今天耶和華必使你遭受災禍。」於是全體以色列人用石頭把他打死。他們用石頭打死他們以後，就把一切用火燒了。

words.note: Often used for bringing trouble or misfortune upon oneself/others.
Often implies undergoing something unpleasant or harmful.
In context with '用石頭', it means 'stoned to death'.
In context with '用石頭', it means 'stoned to death'.

verses.text: 眾人又在亞干身上堆起了一大堆石頭，這堆石頭一直存到今日；於是耶和華就回心轉意，不發烈怒。因此那地方名叫亞割谷，直到今日。

words.note: An idiom meaning to change one's attitude or decision.
